CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: [9][10][11] One of the most powerful and flexible strategies to design low band gap conjugated polymers involves an alternating sequence of electron - donor ( D ) and electron - acceptor ( A ) moieties along the conjugated polymer main chain.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| low band gap conjugated polymers |
| electron - donor (D) |
| electron - acceptor (A) |
| conjugated polymer main chain |

The "Material Name" entities identified in the paragraph are:

1. low band gap conjugated polymers
2. electron - donor (D)
3. electron - acceptor (A)
4. conjugated polymer main chain

These entities are mentioned precisely as they appear in the original paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| low band gap conjugated polymers |
| conjugated polymer main chain |

After re-evaluating the paragraph, the only clear "Material Name" entities are:

1. low band gap conjugated polymers
2. conjugated polymer main chain

These entities are mentioned precisely as they appear in the original paragraph. The other entities, electron - donor (D) and electron - acceptor (A), are not materials themselves but rather roles or properties that moieties can have.
